long_desc.thetext: The organization of the demos in the demobrowser is currently a bit of a mess. Some demos are in UI, others in widgets and other have its own subfolder. So there is no clear structure for a user who wants to search for a specific feature or a specific part of the framework. In some ways this is because of the strict hierarchical structure demos can have. A good solution for that could be tags for demos. We could offer a filter for tags or let the user search for a tag. With tags, the information what is in the demo could be stored and offered to the user.

Added a tagging system with revision 20135 and tagged some data binding demos with revision 20136. I'll keep this bug open because we still need to tag all the other demos and maybe thing of a better organisation of the demos for startup.

After a presentation of the current state in the qooxdoo team, we saw even mor potential in such a system. First, we should move the tags to the class comment and change the format from #tag(name) to @tag name With that, we could also specify a title of the demo using a @title tag, which could replace the title in the demos tree. Another idea is to include a description of the demo in the class comment and add these documentations as an additional description in the demos tabs besides HTML or javascript code.

Moved the tags from #tag(name) to @tag name with commit r21265 and r21266.
Additionally introduced a auto tagging feature for all usages of qx. which adds all classnames and its namespaces to the tags. With that, the user can filter for specific classes of whole namespaces like qx.ui.table. Available with revision r21267.
The description for the demos is already in a separate bug #501
